title.narrative: BUILDING STAFF CAPACITIES TO DELIVER QUALITY NUTRITION SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2020, actors in nutrition- specific and -sensitive sectors have capacity to deliver quality nutrition services., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Supply And Logistics, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 adolescent girls, women of childbearing age (especially pregnant and breastfeeding women) and their children aged 0-59 months adopt better nutrition practices and use quality nutrition-specific and sensitive services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, actors in nutrition- specific and -sensitive sectors have capacity to deliver quality nutrition services.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF sustained strengthening the quality of prevention and management of acute malnutrition. 3,193,954 children under the age of 5 were screened for acute malnutrition combined with vitamin A supplementation and deworming. A total of 103,844 children with SAM were treated with recovery rate of 91.1%. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
